alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued December 22 at 8:03PM EST until December 24 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM FRIDAY TO 1 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Up to one to two feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines. The greatest concern for coastal flooding is around the time of high tides near 10 am Friday and Friday night between 10 pm and 11:30 pm. Large battering waves will lead to significant splashover at both tides. This may cause damage to roadways along the coast and erosion with both tides. * WHERE...Coastal Hancock and Coastal Washington Counties. * WHEN...From 9 AM Friday to 1 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. * WAVE IMPACTS...Expect moderate beach erosion at locations such as Rogue Bluffs due to large breaking waves. Rocks associated with splashover may wash across exposed coastal roads, resulting in road closures and damage to passing vehicles. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
